name: equivalence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of having the same amount, value, purpose, qualities, etc.: There's a general equivalence between the two concepts. I don’t see any moral equivalence between the two sides. See
equivalent
More examplesFewer examplesSomewhere between print and enunciation, the equivalence between sound and sense can get lost.It's probably a mistake to think of the two operating systems in terms of equivalence.Patients often question generic drugs' equivalence to the brand-name drugs.
